item.title: (Irving Kaplansky - Set Theory And Metric Spaces) Capítulo 2, exercício 2.2.7
item.description: Pergunta Given a point $x$ in a metric space $M$, and positive numbers $r$, $s$ with $r < s$, prove that the set of all $y \in M$ satisfying $r < D(x,y) < s$ is open. (A reasonable name for such set is “open ring” or “open annalus”). Solução Defina $A_x = \lbrace y \in M \mid r < D(x,y) < s \rbrace$. Vamos mostrar que $A_x$ é aberto. Seja $a \in A_x$ e considere $B_d(a)$ tal que $d = \frac{\min \lbrace D(x,a) - r, s - D(a,x) \rbrace}{2} $.
